$description: Avatar component tokens. Avatars represent users or entities with images, initials, or icons. These tokens compose primitive tokens into avatar-specific configurations. Use avatars for: user profiles, comment authors, team member lists, contact cards, and assignment indicators. ACCESSIBILITY: Always provide alt text for image avatars; initials should have aria-label with the full name.

size.$description: Avatar dimensions (width and height are equal). Size should match the context and information density.

xs.$description: Extra small avatar (24px). Use for: inline mentions, compact lists, dense data tables.

sm.$description: Small avatar (32px). Use for: comment threads, chat messages, navigation items.

md.$description: Medium avatar (40px). DEFAULT size. Use for: list items, cards, standard user displays.

lg.$description: Large avatar (56px). Use for: profile headers, featured users, team pages.

xl.$description: Extra large avatar (64px). Use for: profile pages, hero sections, prominent user displays.

circle.$description: Circular avatar (full radius). DEFAULT shape. Use for: user photos, profile images.

rounded.$description: Rounded square avatar. Use for: workspace icons, team logos, entity avatars.

borderWidth.$description: Avatar border width (1px). Subtle border separates avatar from background. Applied when avatar needs visual boundary.

fontSize.$description: Initials font size per avatar size. Sized to fill the avatar proportionally.

xs.$description: Initials font size for xs avatar (10px). Compact but readable single or dual character.

sm.$description: Initials font size for sm avatar (12px).

md.$description: Initials font size for md avatar (16px). DEFAULT.

lg.$description: Initials font size for lg avatar (20px).

xl.$description: Initials font size for xl avatar (24px).

fontWeight.$description: Initials font weight. Medium weight ensures initials are legible at small sizes without being overly bold.

group.$description: Avatar group configuration for stacked/overlapping avatar displays.

overlap.$description: Negative margin for overlapping avatars in a group. Creates a stacked visual effect.

ring.$description: Ring border width around each avatar in a group (2px). Creates visual separation between overlapping avatars.

status.$description: Status indicator dot configuration for online/offline/busy states.

borderWidth.$description: Ring around the status indicator dot (1px). Separates dot from avatar image for visual clarity.
